Question: Write Code to remove duplicates from an unsorted linked list.
Title: Remove Dups

Question: Implement an algorithm to find the kth to last element of a singly linked list
Title: Return Kth to Last

Question: Implement an algorithm to delete a node in the middle (i.e., any node but the first and last node, not necessarily in the exact middle) of a singly linked list, given only access to that node.
Title: Delete Middle Node

Question: Write code to partition a linked list around a value x, such that all nodes less than x come before all nodes greater than or equal to x. (IMPORTANT: The partition element x can appear anywhere in the "right partition"; it does not need to appear between the left and right partitions.
Title: Partition

Question: You have two numbers represented by a linked list, where each node contains a single digit.  The digits are stored in reverse order, such that the 1's digit is at the head of the list.  Write a function that adds the two digit numbers and returns the sum as a linked list. (You are not allowed to "cheat" and just convert the linked list to an integer.)
Title: Sum Lists

Question: Implement a function to check if a linked list is a palindrome.
Title: Palindrome

Question: Given two (singly) linked lists, determine if two lists intersect.  Return the intersecting node.  Not that the intersection is defined based on reference, not value.  That is, if the kth node of the first linked list is the exact same node (by reference) as the jth node of the second linked list, then they are intersecting.
Title: Intersection

Question: Given a linked list which might contain a loop, implement an algorithm that returns the node at the beginning of the loop (if one exists).
Title: Loop Detection
